intro: Microcachrys, commonly known as the mountain heath, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. These plants are native to Australia and are typically found in heathland and forested areas. They are evergreen shrubs with small, leathery leaves and produce bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or red. Microcachrys species are adapted to nutrient-poor soils and can thrive in harsh, sunny conditions. Their botanical features make them valuable in horticulture and ecological restoration projects.
